p: The optimized thiol–ene and click chemistries were then extended from a post-polymerization to a post-emulsification modification strategy. PFC nanoemulsions stabilized by 16 and 17 were prepared following the conditions employed for 8 ( Fig. 4A). The resulting emulsions were found to be similar in size, polydispersity and long-term stability to 8 ( Fig. 4A and B, S16 †), indicating the presence of 15 mol% comonomer did not significantly disrupt the hydrophilic–hydrophobic balance of the surfactant. At 15 mol% incorporation of functional handles, these ∼120 nm emulsions contain an estimated 3600 functional groups displayed on the droplet surface—however, this value can be easily modulated through the comonomer feed ratio (see ESI † for calculation details).
